business.headline: East or West, gold is the bestThe sharp rise in gold prices comes at a time when global markets are under pressure due to the falling US dollar and rising uncertainty in the US economy, especially after recent statements by Donald Trump.

China's gold ATM melts jewellery and sends money in 30 minutes. Check here The gold ATM, which is set up in China's Shanghai, melts gold, checks its purity and weight, and transfers the value to your bank account.

Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart may gain from US push in India trade deal: ReportIndia currently imposes restrictions on foreign-owned online retailers, including bans on holding inventory and selling directly to consumers. Domestic players like Reliance, by contrast, face no such constraints, giving them an edge in both online and offline retail.

Air India eyes Boeing jets rejected by China amid trade tensions: ReportThe Tata Group-owned carrier, which is undergoing a fleet overhaul and rapid expansion, is in talks with Boeing Co. to acquire several planes that were being readied for Chinese carriers before fresh tariffs disrupted their delivery.

Is the Rs 500 note in your wallet real or fake? Look out for this small typoThe Ministry of Home Affairs has flagged a surge in fake Rs 500 notes that are so well-made, even experienced handlers are finding it hard to detect them.

Gensol Engineering may face ED probe for money laundering chargesThe latest development comes at a time when Sebi uncovered a fraud at Gensol Engineering and questions are being raised about the company's financial practices.

Gold touches Rs 1 lakh: 5 things you must knowGold June futures on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) hit a record Rs 99,178 per 10 grams on Monday. In the physical market, gold was priced at Rs 97,200 per 10 grams.

RBI allows minors above 10 to operate bank accounts. Check detailsBanks have been given the flexibility to set the rules for these accounts based on their own risk management policies. This includes setting limits on the amount of money that can be kept in such accounts and deciding on the terms and conditions.

Uday Kotak calls Indian housewife 'smartest fund manager' as gold hits Rs 1 lakhUday Kotak praises Indian housewives for their unwavering faith in gold, noting how their instinctive investment strategies have outperformed global financial approaches.

Gold hits Rs 1 lakh milestone: What's driving the rally and should you buy?The surge in gold prices comes amid mounting global uncertainty, fuelled by fresh tensions between President Donald Trump and the US Federal Reserve over rate cuts, and an escalating trade war with China.

Why Sensex, Nifty are gaining despite crash on Wall StreetBenchmark indices on Dalal Street opened higher despite Wall Street's overnight plunge. Is this the latest sign that Indian markets are trying to decouple from the US market's volatility?
Sensex, Nifty turn positive after early fall; IndusInd bank down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 129.12 points to 79,537.62, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 43.85 points to 24,169.40 as of 9:36 am.

entertainment.headline: Priyanka Setia: Hurts when influencers are cast based on social media numbersPriyanka Setia shares her mixed emotions about her new release 'Khauf', addressing the challenges of competing with influencers in Bollywood. She reflects on her journey from an air hostess to an actress, and her aspirations for diverse roles.

Anurag Kashyap apologises to Brahmin community: Forgot dignity due to angerFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap has apologised to the Brahmin community after making controversial remarks. He expressed regret, acknowledging the inappropriateness of his comments.

Aamir Khan's big plans for Mahabharat: Might need multiple filmmakersDuring a recent interview, Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan revealed that he hopes to start working on his dream project, 'The Mahabharat', this year.

Ananya Panday's cousin Ahaan to debut with Saiyaara, release set for July 2025Yash Raj Films is set to release 'Saiyaara', a romantic drama marking Ahaan Panday's entry into Bollywood, on July 18, 2025. The film will be directed by Mohit Suri.

Mahesh Manjrekar bats for Astitva re-release: It doesn't age, it's still topicalVeteran filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar sees the re-release trend as a chance to showcase 'Astitva' again. Despite 'Vaastav's' anniversary, he believes 'Astitva' holds timeless relevance.

Parineeti Chopra reacts to fans calling Raghav Chadha 'jiju' at IPL match. WatchActor Parineeti Chopra reacted to a video of fans chanting 'jiju' after Raghav Chadha attended the RCB vs PBKS IPL match in Chandigarh.

Singer Sonu Nigam warns of fake accounts on X, asks followers to report and blockSinger Sonu Nigam requested his followers to be beware of fake accounts under his name. Stating that he has been inactive on X for eight years, he asked his fans to report and block such accounts.
Rohit Shetty addresses rift with SRK after Dilwale: We have mutual respectFilmmaker Rohit Shetty broke his silence on his alleged rift with Shah Rukh Khan. The director

Actor Vishnu Vishal, badminton player Jwala Gutta welcome baby girlTamil actor Vishnu Vishal and badminton player Jwala Gutta became parents to a baby girl recently. The actor announced the happy news on social media.

Preity Zinta all smiles as Virat Kohli shows Vamika, Akaay's pics after IPL matchThe RCB vs PBKS match on April 20 turned memorable after a viral video featured fun banter between Virat Kohli and Preity Zinta.

Kanye West admits incestuous relationship with cousin: Showed him dirty magazinesKanye West opened up about having a sexual encounter with a male cousin, who is now in prison. He shared his music video, Cousins, on X along with his story.

ED summons actor Mahesh Babu for questioning on April 27 in money laundering caseActor Mahesh Babu has been summoned by the ED for questioning on April 27 in a money laundering probe. The investigation is linked to Hyderabad-based real estate firms accused of fraudulent land deals and unaccounted cash transactions.

Kesari 2 box office Day 4: Akshay Kumar's film stays steady on first MondayAkshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2,' co-starring R Madhavan and Ananya Panday, released on April 18 and opened with around Rs 7.75 crore. In just four days of its release, the film has earned Rs 34 crore.

Rajinikanth delights fans, waves at them from moving car at Jailer 2 shoot. WatchSuperstar Rajinikanth is presently shooting for director Nelson Dilipkumar's 'Jailer 2' in Kerala. He made his fans happy as he greeted them with a big smile on his face on the film's shooting spot.

George Clooney calls himself 'luckiest' in 10-year fight-free marriage with AmalHollywood actor George Clooney revealed that he and his wife, Amal, never fought in their 10-year-long marriage. He further spoke about how their close friends and family are shocked to learn about how they have never argued in their relationship.

'Andor' Season 2: The most grounded chapter in Star Wars history is backAndor Season 2 premieres on Disney+, offering a grounded, emotional take on the Star Wars universe. With strong writing and rich characters, it explores rebellion through everyday heroes, not Jedi legends.

New Oscar rules require voters to watch every nominee, support refugee filmmakersThe Academy now requires Oscar voters to watch all nominated films in a category. New rules support refugee filmmakers, clarify AI use, and introduce future awards for casting and stunt design

Bhabiji... actor Shubhangi Atre's ex-husband Piyush Poorey dies in IndoreShubhangi Atre's former husband, Piyush Poorey, passed away after battling liver cirrhosis in Indore. The actor was not on talking terms with her husband after their divorce earlier this year.

Rapper Hanumankind shares glimpse of debut Coachella performance. WatchRapper Hanumankind made his US debut at Coachella 2025 and shared his journey to the festival on Instagram, showcasing his experiences from rehearsals to the stage.

general news.headline: Parliament is supreme: Jagdeep Dhankhar doubles down on criticism of judiciaryVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar doubled down on criticism of judicial 'overreach' and said that "elected representatives will be ultimate masters" of constitution.

Ramdev to take down Rooh Afza videos after High Court rap on 'sharbat jihad'The Delhi High Court slammed Baba Ramdev for his "sharbat jihad" remark targeting Rooh Afza, calling it "indefensible" and shocking. Following the court's criticism, Patanjali agreed to take down the controversial videos.

Pope Francis's funeral on Saturday, Vatican releases his photos in open coffinThe Vatican has released the first images of Pope Francis, showing him lying in his casket while the Vatican Secretary of State prays over him. Pope Francis, 88, died on Monday after suffering a stroke and cardiac arrest.

East or West, gold is the bestThe sharp rise in gold prices comes at a time when global markets are under pressure due to the falling US dollar and rising uncertainty in the US economy, especially after recent statements by Donald Trump.

After new Pope, world to get its first millennial saintCarlo Acutis, a British-Italian teenager, known as God's influencer for coding and creating Christian websites, was slated to be canonised as the first millennial saint on April 27.  With the death of Pope Francis, Acutis' canonisation will have to wait for now. Hundreds of pilgrims have been making a beeline for the Italian town of Assisi every day to his tomb, and offer prayers.

Air Force officer charged with attempted murder in Bengaluru road rage caseIndian Air Force officer Shiladitya Bose, who claimed he was assaulted, now faces charges after a counter-complaint was filed by the biker involved. CCTV footage also showed Bose initiated the confrontation.

Tote-ally political: Bansuri Swaraj's 'National Herald ki Loot' bag targets GandhisThe bag, an unmistakable jibe at the Gandhi family, is the latest in a series of handbag statements in Parliament - this time from the BJP in response to Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's recent outings with politically loaded tote bags.

US considers $5,000 'baby bonus', pro-family policies to fight birth rate slumpIn recent weeks, White House aides have met with policy advocates and conservative groups aligned with what is known as the pronatalist movement - an ideological campaign to boost population growth through pro-family incentives and messaging.

Watch: Saudi fighter jets escort PM Modi's plane in special airspace welcomeSaudi Arabian fighter jets escorted the Prime Minister's aircraft, Air India One as it entered the country's airspace en route to Jeddah.

Techie dies after fall from zipline tower at Pune adventure parkA 28-year-old Pune techie, Taral Atpalkar, died after falling from a zipline tower at Rajgad Water Park Resort. Police are probing possible negligence by the resort staff.

Commentator Harsha Bhogle breaks silence on missing KKR games amid controversyIPL 2025: Decorated commentator Harsha Bhogle clarified his absence from the broadcast team for Kolkata Knight Riders' home games, dismissing rumours surrounding the matter.

Anurag Kashyap apologises to Brahmin community: Forgot dignity due to angerFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap has apologised to the Brahmin community after making controversial remarks. He expressed regret, acknowledging the inappropriateness of his comments.

Woman shares what it's like to intern inside Tihar's all-male block in viral postWhat's it like being the only woman psychology intern inside India's largest prison complex? A Ghaziabad-based trainee gave a no-frills account in a now-viral post on LinkedIn.

Nitin Gadkari plans law to use Indian musical instruments sound as vehicle hornsUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari plans a law to mandate vehicle horns mimic Indian musical instruments like flute, tabla, and harmonium, aiming to make road sounds more pleasant and soothing.

Meet the 4 Indian cardinals who will be part of conclave to elect new PopeAmong the 135 cardinals eligible to vote for the next Pope are four from India, including two from the southern state of Kerala.

Indian, 20, molests Singapore Airlines cabin crew member pushing her into toiletA 20-year-old Indian national has been charged with allegedly molesting a cabin crew member aboard a Singapore Airlines (SIA) flight. Earlier in April, an Indian-origin retired banker was sentenced to nine months in jail for molesting four SIA cabin crew members.

Man apologises in Kannada after telling Bengaluru auto driver to 'speak Hindi'A viral video of a man asking a Bengaluru auto driver to speak Hindi sparked outrage online. After criticism, he posted a public apology in Kannada, recognising the city's significance in his life.

An honour to welcome JD Vance, says Bhajanlal SharmaUS Vice President JD Vance, currently on a four-day official visit to India, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday and hailed him as a "great leader". Strengthening bilateral ties between the two democracies is at the heart of Vance's agenda during this high-profile trip. This morning, Vice President Vance arrived in Jaipur, Rajasthan, where he is scheduled to explore the city's rich cultural heritage. He will visit Amber Fort at 9 am on Tuesday, followed by a keynote address on US-India relations at the Rajasthan International Centre (RIC) at 3 pm. The Vice President is staying at the historic Rambagh Palace during his Jaipur leg. Accompanying him on the visit are his wife, Usha Vance, their children, and a delegation of senior officials from the US administration.

Tiger first or human traditions? Why a boy met death in RanthamboreKnown for its majestic tigers, Ranthambore now cries for visionary rescue from the ever-expanding human footprint in the name of religion and safari and wedding tourism

Tamil Nadu Governor verdict doesn't apply to Kerala: Centre to Supreme CourtThe Centre told the Supreme Court that its ruling against the Tamil Nadu Governor doesn't apply to Kerala. The court agreed to hear the Kerala matter on May 6.
Never-before-seen dark rock found on Mars. Nasa names it Skull HillSkull Hill is a type of "float" rock — one that likely originated elsewhere and was transported to its current location.

TS Inter Result 2025 live: Telangana intermediate 1st and 2nd year results declaredTSBIE Telangana Intermediate 1st Year, 2nd Year Results Live Updates: The Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education (TSBIE) has announced the TS Inter 1st and 2nd Year Results 2025 today at 12 pm. Students can download their marksheets from the official website — tgbie.cgg.gov.in.

UP man returns from Dubai, murdered over wife-nephew's affair, dumped in own bagPolice say the victim's wife, who was in a relationship with his nephew, got her husband killed with the help of the nephew and his friend.

Ex-Karnataka top cop's wife googled death by neck vein cuts before murder: SourcesPallavi, wife of ex-Karnataka DGP Om Prakash, allegedly researched fatal neck injuries before fatally stabbing him at their Bengaluru home. She was arrested and their daughter Kriti is undergoing psychiatric evaluation.​

sports.headline: Aussie cricketer gets jail term for domestic violence, walks free due to time servedFormer Australian cricketer Michael Slater was sentenced to four years in prison on charges of domestic violence, stalking and strangulation in relation to multiple incidents involving a woman in Queensland. Slater, however, will walk free after having served more than a year in custody.

Dwayne Bravo continues to defend KKR batters, says they're lacking confidenceKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) mentor Dwayne Bravo defended the team's batters following another shambolic performance against Gujarat Titans. KKR were restricted to 159/8 chasing 199 as they lost the match by 39 runs.

Yuvraj stopped Abhishek from meeting girlfriends and late parties: Yograj SinghLegendary India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj revealed that his son stopped Abhishek Sharma from partying late night and meeting girlfriends to discipline him.

Sai Sudharsan shows T20s can be played in traditional style: Ambati RayuduIPL 2025, KKR vs GT: Sai Sudharsan may not be your typical T20 big-hitter, but the elegant Gujarat Titans opener is reaping rewards for his consistency. He grabbed the Orange Cap on Monday with a match-winning fifty in Kolkata.

Mayank Yadav is fit, management will take a call on his selection: Yuvraj ChaudharyLucknow Super Giants (LSG) all-rounder Yuvraj Chaudhary has revealed that fast bowler Mayank Yadav is fit and captain Rishabh Pant and head coach Justin Langer will take a call on his selection against Delhi Capitals.

IPL 2025: KL Rahul helping plot plans against LSG, reveals Vipraj Nigram DC's Vipraj Nigam admitted that the team is tapping into KL Rahul's knowledge about the LSG squad ahead of their game on Tuesday, April 22. Rahul captained LSG for three seasons before joining DC.

LSG vs DC: Delhi take on feisty Lucknow to rebuild winning momentumIPL 2025, LSG vs DC Prediction: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) will host Delhi Capitals (DC) in Match 40 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), where both teams will have a golden chance to climb higher on the points table.

Harsha Bhogle breaks silence on missing KKR games: Inappropriate conclusions drawnIPL 2025: Decorated commentator Harsha Bhogle clarified his absence from the broadcast team for Kolkata Knight Riders' home games, dismissing rumours surrounding the matter.

IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals face match fixing allegations after shocking loss vs LSGIndian Premier League franchise Rajasthan Royals (RR) have found themselves in a controversy following their shocking loss against Lucknow Super Giants. Rajasthan Cricket Association (RCA) ad hoc committee convener has alleged that the team was involved in match fixing.

LSG vs DC: Revitalised KL Rahul out to hurt his former franchise LucknowAfter an unceremonious exit from LSG, KL Rahul returns to his former stomping ground, revitalised and with a point to prove. Will Rahul come back to haunt his former team, this time in the colours of DC?

LSG vs DC: Delhi take on feisty Lucknow to rebuild winning momentumIPL 2025, LSG vs DC Prediction: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) will host Delhi Capitals (DC) in Match 40 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), where both teams will have a golden chance to climb higher on the points table.

Harsha Bhogle breaks silence on missing KKR games: Inappropriate conclusions drawnIPL 2025: Decorated commentator Harsha Bhogle clarified his absence from the broadcast team for Kolkata Knight Riders' home games, dismissing rumours surrounding the matter.

IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals face match fixing allegations after shocking loss vs LSGIndian Premier League franchise Rajasthan Royals (RR) have found themselves in a controversy following their shocking loss against Lucknow Super Giants. Rajasthan Cricket Association (RCA) ad hoc committee convener has alleged that the team was involved in match fixing.

LSG vs DC: Revitalised KL Rahul out to hurt his former franchise LucknowAfter an unceremonious exit from LSG, KL Rahul returns to his former stomping ground, revitalised and with a point to prove. Will Rahul come back to haunt his former team, this time in the colours of DC?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
